citeinfo.origin: Exxon, Alaska Department of Natural Resources, USDC Forest Service, Chugach National Forest
citeinfo.title: Exxon Coastline - EVOS Database

descript.abstract: Data Type: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill; The digital shoreline produced by EXXON through the use of a local mapping firm. This dataset is the 1:60,000 air photo update to the state shoreline produced by USFS and DNR at a scale of 1:63,360 using the coastline from USGS 1: 63360 map series and 1:31,360 timbertype map base. The intended use of this dataset was to provide an accurate, detailed, and updated shoreline for use in resource mapping and analysis for the EVOS damage assessment and restoration efforts, that would be used by all agencies working in the spill effected area.

idinfo.useconst: Photos are not synchronized with tides. Land water interfaces can vary considerably from adopted standards of mean high water. The contractor did provide a datum which approximated mean high water.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
